alert.note: Alert for Trumbull (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 8:30PM EST until February 24 at 8:50AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station affecting Trumbull County. ...Observed flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Ohio... Mahoning River At Leavittsburg affecting Trumbull County. For the Site Specific Non-forecast Pt...including Phalanx Station... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Barclay Messerly Road, McConnell East, and Knowlton Roads will be flooded and impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 11.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM EST Wednesday was 11.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 5.0 feet late Friday evening. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight by 545 AM EST.
